A very detailed custom snow map with interesting lighting. http://resource.openra.net/maps/8376
Has been featured in FiveAces' and @SoScared's streams already. Reimported with https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10397.

data.body:
Classic map that already works as it doesn't have any bridges. Test case for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10397.

http://resource.openra.net/maps/8377

data.title: Don't update player list when lobby doesn't have our client yet
data.body:
Fixes #10450.

I was actually only able to reproduce this once (on the first try, too), never again after that. But with the crash happening on [this line](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyLogic.cs#L895), it's pretty clear what's going on. Since quite a few more things are referencing that, I decided to move the check up to the top of the method. It's probably fair to assume that both the loops running before the check in line 895 would have iterated over empty collections anyway, so they wouldn't have done anything useful, so we might just as well bail out early.

data.title: Permanent "Fake" tag for fake buildings
data.body:
Similar to the "Always show status bars" option, but for Fake buildings.

To keep track of your own buildings / fake buildings, without having to select them.

Also could be used on enemy identified fake buildings, if this #10355 is implemented 

" pchote:  IMO the most logical behaviour is for the spy to be consumed, and the 'fake' tag being revealed to the infiltrator. "

Cleaned up all the nullable types

data.title: Sending back air units after being reloaded
data.body:
One more problem with air units :)

I didn't find a way to back air units to a predefined position 
- either a previously targeted building they didn't finish to destroy 
- or to the rally point

(Is there any way ?)

For example, rally point works for the Service Depot, so you don't need to micro a repaired unit. 
I think the same would be useful for air units.

Another reason to fix this : reloaded air units in stand-by block the production. Sending them back automatically to the field could solve the problem.

Micro wouldn't disappear, as you would have to manage your units and their reload cycles, if you have more units than airfields / helipads. 
But it would reduce the annoyances I cited before, and make airforce more comfortable to use.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29668030-sending-back-air-units-after-being-reloaded?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: British Spy cash trick - Lowering minimum theft to 250$
data.body:
Hi :) 

When entering a refinery, while enemy not having resources, the British Spy steals 500$, while costing 250$.
Spamming spies next to an enemy ref can get you an instant economy boost, which is not justified IMO for England particularly.

This could be capped to a 250$ theft.

data.title: Rare Crash when entering Lobby
data.body:
This crash can only happen if you click Skirmish button fast enough. I wish I could say more, but that's how I get this crash. You can reliably recreate this if you can click on the Skirmish button fast enough. (I'd say about 4 or 5 times a second)

Here is a paste of the crash log: http://pastebin.com/6tAKpdaK

Safe to say that someone with patience will never encounter this issue, but if you're like me and like to spam the mouse button it'll happen from time to time.

data.title: Difficulty to reload Hinds / Longbows - Blocking behaviour
data.body:
(See also #10449)
Hello :)

I think air units behaviour have improved throughout releases, but I still have problems managing Hinds, in order to reload them. 

While Yaks seem to have a good behaviour (i.e. sending a group of 4 Yaks to reload, while having 4 Airstrips works good), Hinds don't, and tend to block each other (i.e. sending a group of 4 Hinds to reload, while having 4 Helipads doesn't work most of the time).

Therefore, I have to send Hinds individually to each Helipad, which is too much time consuming, and makes them harder to use than Yaks (balance problem).

Possible solution : 
Maybe this could be solved by allowing Hinds to pass over / through each other ? 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29665151-difficulty-to-reload-hinds-longbows-blocking-behaviour?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: (When using dual monitors?) Print screen shows an old version of the openRA window.
data.body:
Hit print screen and it will just show the openRA logo/loading screen. Sometimes if you're REALLY lucky it will show you the game lobby!
If you are SUPER lucky and all the planets are aligned! You might actually get a shot of the current game you're playing!

data.title: Camo Pillbox visable under fog of war.
data.body:
1)Get shot at by a enemy Camo Pillbox
2)Move out of view range of it
3)Fog of war regrows before Camo Pillbox cloaks
4)It is now visible just like any other building until you uncover the area again

data.title: Add support for the OpenGL Shader Language
data.body:
A nice Feature would be to add support for GLSL in OpenRA. Shader programing gives us and the Modders the ability to "change" many things at based on vertex and fragment shaders for vertexes.

We can change:
- lightining (for Day / night), 
- Color (for Debug overlay)
- shadows, 
- cloaking (alpha) 

based on vertex manipulation and shaders Shaders can be written and modified in textfiles and has to be compiled  at gamestart, they could be passed via mod.yaml `Shaders:`

what i mean what we could have is like this (example in minecraft)
look at the water and lighting 

http://i1.wp.com/minecraftsix.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/shader-mod.jpg

data.title: Building with turrets gets broken when attacked before finishing make anim.

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Building with turrets gets broken when attacked before finishing make anim.

How to reproduce:
- Build a defense with a turret.
- While it's displaying the make anim, attack it.
- Building should now not have a turret at all, makeing it not able to attack or beeing sold.
- In some rare cases the turret gets displayed but then shares the same problems as the one without displayed turrets.

data.title: RA balance
data.body:
Making a single issue for everyone to discuss RA balance for the next release due to the feedback in another thread https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10432#issuecomment-169298999

The last big rebalance mainly happened due to a chance conversation between lots of people on IRC, so this may be a good place to collect everyone's views and thoughts. I'll let others start as I know some people have interesting ideas for certain issues which I am keen to hear.
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Air units can land on top of ground units
data.body:
If you issue a command for a helicopter to land on a tile, then issue a command for a ground unit to move to the tile before the helicopter lands, or vice-versa, the units will both move to the same square and the helicopter will land with the unit stood on top of it. Please see link for a replay demonstrating this. This also works with the repair pad.

[Download air_bugs.orarep](https://www.dropbox.com/s/iv018izrxwkdo67/air_bugs.orarep?dl=0)

data.title: Air units do not build when a unit is returning to reload
data.body:
If you're building an air unit and all of you airstrips/helipads have units returning to reload, your air units won't build, they just sit on ready until the unit has returned to and then left the airstrip, this makes sense if the unit is actually on the airstrip/helipad, but I don't think it makes sense when the unit is returning to reload.

data.title: Queuing order does not work with left-hand-side shift
data.body: I play on a laptop and queuing commands does not work with the shift key on the left-hand-side of my keyboard, the right-hand-side shift key works fine but it's really awkward to get to

data.title: MapPreview should not hold a live reference to Map
data.body:
Keeping a copy of every map in memory is becoming a problem for dedicated servers that sync with the resource center: we are now looking at 600MB+ memory usage per server instance just for the maps.

Maps should be loaded on demand to get the info that is required, and then disposed.

> [04:40:57]    <xnaquada> The RA servers initial load is 340-380mb without any runs (e.g. noone has played on them since restart). After they get some plays, the ram can approach somewhere between 500-600mb
> [04:41:18]  <xnaquada> I can actually tell what servers are what by ram usage
> [04:41:51]  <xnaquada> RA =~350mb CNC ~160mb D2K ~33mb (all inital load after a fresh restart)
> [04:42:14]  <xnaquada> kyrylo, what O/S?
> [04:42:48]  <kyrylo> ubuntu
> [04:43:41]  <xnaquada> (ram use is all per instance/openra server btw, just to be clear for clarity's sake).
> [04:44:40]  <xnaquada> I've observed 500-600mb is where I end up eventually for the RA mod after some plays.
> [04:47:04]  <kyrylo> i just have 1 server with 1 instance
> [04:47:11]  <kyrylo> I end up with 850
> [04:47:21]  <kyrylo> starting from 600
> [04:47:31]  <kyrylo> so those 250 megs are never freed

data.title: changed the light tank's cost from $700 to $600
data.body:
this was done because the medium tank (far better than the light) costs only $150 more than the light tank which basicly gives people no reason to build the light tank after they get out a service depo

at the same time the hum-v costs $500 so you wouldn't want people to have a better alternative
but then again the hum-v counters infantry so it has its own purpose.

data.title: dogs bug
data.body:
1 dog < 1 rilfeman
$200 > $100
- mass dog < mass of riflemen

dog has its perks (moves faster, detects spies) but there is a problem with the way in which it attacks where it doesn't attack instantly but instead moves a couple squares then attacks which is horrible because with how low its health is when it is up against most other units it dies before ever attacking.
this is even worse when doing an attack move moves
